abstracts.cdata!:
The project will assist the Government
            of Mongolia to mainstream the results achieved and lessons
            learned through the Mongolia Legal and Judicial Reform
            Project. The project is specifically designed to scale-up
            the main activities of the on-going Legal and Judicial
            Reform Project, to enhance the pilot areas which have
            demonstrated positive results, and to introduce
            complementary activities reflecting lessons learned
            throughout the justice sector. The project will strengthen
            the capacity of the Judiciary, by working through the
            Supreme Court and General Council of Courts, and the
            Executive Branch, through the Ministry of Justice and Home
            Affairs (MOJHA) and its specialized agencies. The Project
            will also support the development of a special bilingual
            legal information program for the Kazakh speaking population
            of the Bayan-Ulgii Aimag. It is not expected that the
            Project will have any negative environmental impacts.
